page.title: 10FARM LIFE
page.content: Getting up as usual about 6.45, go downstairs whisk up the buckets for the calves from Holmfirth market. If we have any of course, take 2 buckets ofbeef nuts across to the chained up cows, hay and water them, have breakfast. (night). the same process excepting mucking out the cows and looking round the sheep. Late spring is when we start the sheep sheareing and lambing season too. Summer (morning/night) By now all the sheep shearing and dipping is all done and the animals turned out till the beginning of October, also we put in the fly ear tags for the cattle and she4p,and worm them. Autumn(morning/night) Same as spring getting op early. The
